alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 6:54AM EST until February 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Paintsville affecting Johnson County. ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 32.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is near crest and will begin to recede today, but is expected to run high into Sunday night. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by 5 PM EST.
